page.title: 16LOCH MEALLBRODDEN
page.content: This small loch is situated in the most north easternly corner of the area and is surrounded by woodland. There is a small, dilapidated damn at the west end probably built so that the loch could be used for fishing. The loch has wild brown trout in it and a permit for the fishing can be obtained from Abercarney estate who own the loch, the surrounding land and the fishing rights. There is also a boat-house with one boat in it for the use of any anglers. The loch has two streams flowing out of it and the woodland around the loch provides shelter for a varied selection of wildlife and also a very picturesc setting.
